snippet: Four Jewish men killed Tuesday while praying at their neighborhood synagogue all lived on the same block, and three were rabbis — one the scion of a celebrated Hasidic dynasty.
abstract: Four Jewish men who were killed while at prayer in Jerusalem by Palestinian assailants were all members of neighborhood synagogue and lived on the same street; congregants attend funerals for Rabbi Moshe Twersky, Rabbi Kalman Zeev Levine, Aryeh Kupinsky and Rabbi Avraham Shmuel Goldberg, mourning loss of synagogue's 'wise scholars.'

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER, TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and JOSEPH BERGER
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, Timothy Williams from New York, and Joseph Berger from Larchmont, N.Y. Reporting was contributed by Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London, Gabby Sobelman from Jerusalem, Laurie Goodstein from New York, and Jess Bidgood from Boston.

lead_paragraph: Four Jewish men killed Tuesday while praying at their neighborhood synagogue all lived on the same block, and three were rabbis — one the scion of a celebrated Hasidic dynasty.

headline.main: Jewish Victims, All From One Jerusalem Street, Were a Congregation’s ‘Wise Scholars’
headline.print_headline: Jewish Victims, All From One Street, Were a Congregation’s ‘Wise Scholars’
